message_1:
Consider the following higher-order logic statement:

∀f∈P(S), ∃a∈S, ∀b∈f, a≤b

If S has 5 elements, how many possible subsets are there in P(S)?
message_2:
The power set P(S) contains all possible subsets of a set S. If S has 5 elements, then the number of possible subsets in P(S) is 2^n, where n is the number of elements in S.

So, there are 2^5 = 32 possible subsets in P(S).
